page.title: 14RECREATION - PETWORTH RURAL
page.content: For young people who have left school there are Leisure Centres at Fittleworth, Petworth and Midhurst, with a number of sports available, including swimming, badminton and tennis. One private house in the district has a hard surface tennis court installed for their own use. It was completed by three men in as many weeks. The village green at Wisborough Green is devoted to cricket. There is a little fishing in the rivers Kird and Arun, and one farm has its own lake containing carp. The Billingshurst Angling Society are very active at week ends on this lake. At Hawkhurst Court a Residents Association is being formed which, beside safeguarding the shared interests of its community, will provide recreational opportunities for members.
